# Task

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".



# Data

clean_column("My Column")

Here is a Julia solution:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[\s-]+" => "_")
end

println(clean_column("My Column"))  # Output: my_column
```
This function first converts the string to lower case, then removes any leading or trailing white spaces using `strip()`. It replaces all spaces and hyphens with underscores using `replace()` and a regular expression. The `r"[\s-]+"` pattern matches one or more whitespace characters (spaces or tabs) or hyphens.

This function can be tested with other column names as well:
```julia
println(clean_column("Another Column"))  # Output: another_column
```
